name: Sumo Squats
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outward at a 45-degree angle.
2. Keep your weight evenly distributed between both feet, engaging your core and keeping your back straight.

3. Lower your body down into a squat position by bending your knees, keeping them in line with your toes as you descend.

4. Ensure that your knees do not extend past your toes, maintaining control throughout the movement.

5. Keep your weight in the heels of your feet and lower yourself down until your arms have dropped to your sides, about 90 degrees from the ground.

6. From this position, push through your heels to straighten out your legs and return to standing.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Sumo squats are a variation of the standard squat exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and core muscles.
